alert.note: Alert for Rutherford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 11:02PM EDT until July 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Parts of western Cleveland County and eastern Rutherford County in Polkville, Kingstown, and Sunshine, NC. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Roads and low-lying areas near US-226 and W Stage Coach Trail in western Cleveland County may see localized flooding. Other impacted areas may included areas around Hollis Road, Stick Elliot Road, and Hoover Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lawndale, Polkville and Kingstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
